Rules
Inspired by Equinox's, Glork's and Ether's rulesets.
important bit
  • 14-day day phase, 48 hour night phase
  • Majority lynches
  • 48 hours before prod, 24 hours before replacement, 24 hour weekends
  • Bah posts allowed (limit: 1, free of game related content)
  • I have some unusual rules about animated GIFs, tiny text, prodging, last words, quoting PTs, twilight, and fall back kills. Scroll down for details.
  • Don’t be a dick

  1. Follow all site rules.
  2. Mod colour - My mod colour is brown and red faded text; don't use it.
  3. Behaviour - Don’t be a dick. This is a heated game but below the belt attacks will not be tolerated. Attack the play not the player.
  4. Don't talk about ongoing games - You may not talk to each other about this game outside of threads I have created for this purpose. You may not talk about other ongoing games in this thread.
  5. Animated GIFs - are of the devil, but they are permitted behind spoilers if clearly labelled as such.
  6. Tiny text - is also of the devil, keep it 70+ please.
  7. Provable randomness - is against the rules. Saying that you rolled a dice is fine, using dice tags or random.org is not.
  8. Cryptography - is forbidden. Breadcrumbing is okay.
  9. Confirmation - You have about 48 hours to confirm your role and your alignment by PM. Game will start sooner if everyone confirms. Posting in a private topic counts as confirmation.
  10. Days - Days last about 14 days, starting at 8am GMT and ending at 1 PM GMT. Extensions may be granted if there are replacements.
  11. Activity - You must post at least once every 48 hours or I will Prod you. You then have 24 hours to post in the game thread or I will replace you. The activity timers run at half-speed on weekends. If you need to be absent for longer than this, you should declare V/LA in bold in the thread like this: [b]@Mod: I will be v/la until Thursday[/b].
  12. Prodging - A naked "prod dodge" does not reset the prod timer. To avoid being prodded/replaced for inactivity, include some game advancing content in your prodges, such as "got prodded; xxxx is still scum."
  13. Last words - If you replace out, you may PM me with a message to leave for the person who replaces you and I'll pass it on to them.
  14. Quoting - You can always directly quote from the public thread into any private threads I have given you access to, and from any neighbourhood threads into your scum PT. You can always quote yourself, unless it contains text that you haven't yourself written. Everything else must be paraphrased in a manner that clearly indicates it is a paraphrase. This includes but is not limited to: private mod communication including role pms and answers to questions, from neighbourhoods into public thread, from neighbourhoods into each other, from mafia PT into anywhere.
  15. Voting - Votes must be in bold in the format VOTE: Plotinus or Vote: Plotinus. Strong preference for using vote tags instead of bold tags. Unvotes are nice but not required. If I think it’s a vote, it’s a vote, no tricks. Type [v]Plotinus[/v] to vote and [uv]Plotinus[/uv] to unvote.
  16. Lynching - Days end early when a simple majority of players (50% of living players + 1 rounded down) vote to lynch somebody. If a majority is not reached at deadline or if a majority of the players vote for no lynch, the day will end without a lynch. At evens, 50% is sufficient for no lynch.
  17. Twilight - Begins when a majority is reached and lasts until I lock the thread: usually at the next pagetop. Later if I was afk, sooner if the flipped person requests it. You're still alive until I flip you so you can talk in any game threads you have access to until then, but no votes or unvotes will be counted.
  18. Night - Night lasts at least 48 hours, ending at 9am UTC+2.
  19. Action submissions - You may submit actions via PM (if town) or PT (if scum). If the actions are not submitted by the deadline then you do nothing that night unless you're scum in which case I'll use an algorithm to determine a fallback kill for you because inactivity nokills are lame. You can change your mind as many times as you like before the deadline.
  20. Reminders - If I don't hear from you about your night actions, I'll PM you 24 hours before the deadline. This doesn't count as a prod. If I still don't hear from you, you will take no action (with the exception of the scum factional kill).
  21. Play to win - and have fun!

Important setup information:

The setup is 10 town vs 3 mafia. A scum player may kill and perform another action in the same night. At least one player has received this role PM:

VT Role PMHello XXXX,

You are a town Vanilla Townie.

During the day, you may vote for players you think are scummy and may use your words to convince other players to vote with you. During the night, you may reread the game thread in search of scumslips you missed during the daytime.

Alignment/win condition: You are a town aligned Vanilla Townie who can win with the town, which will happen when all threats to the town have been eliminated.

Good luck and have fun!

Confirm: by PMing me your role and alignment.

The game thread is here.

Randomising roles and making PTs now! Sending out role PMs (one at a time in the order of signups) very soon!

Bumping this to say that all role PMs have been sent out. Please reply with your role and alignment so that I know you read it. We will begin in (expired on 2016-07-09 09:00:00) or once everyone has confirmed, whichever happens sooner.

I want to hypo results this game. Thinking out loud, wanted to do this all at once but it seems the longer I put it off until I have a significant chunk of time the longer I put off the game in general.

Explicitly Normal Investigative Roles:
Cop, Follower, Gunsmith, Jack of All Trades, Jailkeeper, Motion Detector, Neopolitan, Rolecop, Tracker, Vanilla Cop, Watcher

I don't think Rolecop should need to crumb their results.
Follower's results can be in the form of: Informative, Protective, Manipulative, Killing, Miscellaneous
Jailkeeper crumbs aren't important until 1 scum left
Tracker results are in the form of Person A --> Person B
Watcher results are in the form of Person B --> People Targeting.
JOAT needs to specify when they're using their investigative.

Hypoing format would be as simple (or complicated) as

N1 Murdercat Positive Vedith, Dragon of the West.
JOAT first investigative action.

If the player flipped cop/gunsmith, Murdercat would be scum (Target was murdercat, result was negative so "mafia" or "gun"). If Motion Detector, it would mean that motion was detected. If follower, it would mean that Murdercat used a protective action (Vedith is the second on the playerlist, "Protective" is the second follower option. If tracker, it would mean that Murdercat was seen following around Vedith. If watcher, it would mean that Dragon of the West and Vedith were seen targeting Murdercat. If JOAT, it would mean that the JOAT did use their investigative and thus the first investigative result listed in the role would count (so if JOAT flips Roleblocker, Cop, Tracker then it means that he used his cop and found Murdercat to be scum). If Vanilla Cop or Neapolitan, Murdercat would have returned Vanilla.

No, this is not all I plan on doing.

In post 273, Nachomamma8 wrote:N1 Murdercat Positive Vedith, Dragon of the West.
JOAT first investigative action.

If the player flipped cop/gunsmith, Murdercat would be scum (Target was murdercat, result was negative so "mafia" or "gun"). If Motion Detector, it would mean that motion was detected. If follower, it would mean that Murdercat used a protective action (Vedith is the second on the playerlist, "Protective" is the second follower option. If tracker, it would mean that Murdercat was seen following around Vedith. If watcher, it would mean that Dragon of the West and Vedith were seen targeting Murdercat. If JOAT, it would mean that the JOAT did use their investigative and thus the first investigative result listed in the role would count (so if JOAT flips Roleblocker, Cop, Tracker then it means that he used his cop and found Murdercat to be scum). If Vanilla Cop or Neapolitan, Murdercat would have returned Vanilla.

This is what I mean that it's a claim that has 11 different pieces.
The same hypoclaim (Murdercat Positive Vedith, Dragon of the West) could mean that Murdercat is Vanilla or Murdercat is Guilty or Mudercat targeted another player or was targeted or used a protective action, etc.
Because the same claim can mean such a large number of things, it's much more difficult to PoE based on those claims alone. Does that make sense?

Next, elaborating on the plan. A hypoclaim is a claim where all players claim what results they would have gotten if they have a power role so that power roles can truthfully claim their results without the scum being able to root them out immediately and kill them. The advantage of this plan is that there will be a 0% chance of a power role dying without town getting their advantage, which is mitigated by scum having a higher chance of finding power roles, which I hope will be significantly mitigated by the increased number of possibilities that each hypoclaim represents.

The format of each hypoclaim goes like this:

Night X Name of Player Positive/Negative Name of Player, Additional Name(s) of Players (optional)
JOAT Ability (optional)

This means that you always need a night, a name of a player, the word POSITIVE or NEGATIVE, and then the name of another player.

Examples of proper hypoclaims:

N1 Jester Positive Vedith
1st Investigative JOAT

N2 Dwlee Negative Hiplop, Raskolinov, Nachomamma8

N3 MURDERCAT Positive MURDERCAT

Prod timer runs slower on the weekends. Bella is the person who is next due for a prod and it will happen in about five hours. (ASP and Jester are either already prodded or V/LA.)

The way it works is suppose that somebody posts at 6am on Thursday. If there weren't a weekend, they'd be due for a prod at 6am on Saturday but time runs slower on the weekends, so instead of 6am on Saturday it's due at noon on Saturday. In Bella's case she posted at 21:48 on Thursday so she's due for a prod at 19:36 on Sunday, and will have until 21:48 Monday to respond to the prod.

Life is more fun if you structure it to maximise the amount of mental maths required to do basic tasks. Happy 199th day of the year; it is prime.

I think that this game would've benefitted from taking a little bit of time to digest the previous days events before quicklynching, and that an important thing to take away from this game and that we really need to get a claim from everybody before lynching if possible and if it's not a deadline scramble, that everybody needs to have a chance to respond to a claim and to major wagons, not just because of counterclaims but also because of associatives between buddies and giving everyone a chance to speak. Town won anyway, but it might not have got to 3p lylo if there had been a little more time for discussion between night phases.

I was sad that Dragon was lynched day 1 without having a chance to claim his role because I felt it would be a good opportunity to consider a person's play overall, not just what role they claim, but how they claim it and what their night actions are and how they use it, and what else they've been doing, and I was curious if anyone could mod meta me enough to realise that there was a decent chance it would be a scum role: it was a combination of my role in Tarot and I won a scumgame earlier this year in large part due to being neighbourised early on.

I felt the scum team did a pretty good job of corralling the town into mislynch after mislynch but their luck ran out in the end, and town rallied in the last couple day phases and started to fight back and the tide turned.

See you guys around, thank you all for playing in my game.
